intro: Hieracium caudatulum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium caudatulum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, showing adaptability to a range of environmental conditions.
